gurmukhi: ijn rIJ BBICn rwju dXo kup kY ds sIs deI ijn pIVw ] mwrq hY dl dYqn ko iCn mY Gn so kr dIn auJIVw ]
transliteration: Jin Reejh Bhabheechhan Raaj(u) Dayo Koup Kai Das Sees Daijin Peedaa|| Maarat Hai Dal Daitan Ko Chhin Mai Ghan So Kar Deen Ujheeraa||
translation: He, who, being pleased, gave kingdom to Vibhishana and being enraged, destroyed Ravana; he who chops into bits the demon forces in an instant, humiliating them;

gurmukhi: jwih mrXo mur nwm mhw sur Awpn hI lMG mwrg BIVw ] so Pun BUim ibKY biRj kI sMg gopn kY su krY rs kRIVw ]477]
transliteration: Jaah(i) Daryo Mur Naam Mahaa Sur Aapan Hilanh Maarag Bheedaa|| So Phoun Bhoom(i) Bikhai Brij Kisan Gopan Kai Su Darai Ras Kridaa||477||
translation: Who killed the demon named Mur, the same Krishna is now absorbed in amorous play with the gopis in Braja;477.

gurmukhi: Kylq kwnH soaU iqn so ijh kI su khY sB hI jg jwqRw ] so sB hI jg ko piq hY iqn jIvn ky bl kI pr mwqRw ]
transliteration: Khelat Kaahn Sooo Tin So Jih Kisu Kahai Sabh Hijag Jaatraa|| So Sabh Hijag Ko Pat(i) Hai Tin Jeevan Ke Bal Kipar Maatraa||
translation: The same Krishna is absorbed in the amorous play, whom the whole world appreciated, he is the Lord of all the world and is the support of the life of the whole world;

gurmukhi: rwm hÍY rwvn so ijnhUM kuip ju`D krXo kir kY pRm CwqRw ] so hir ] bIc AhIrn ky kirby khu kauqk kIn su nwqRw ]478]
transliteration: Raam Hvai Raavan So Jinhoon Koup(i) Juddh Daryo Kar(i) Kai Pram Chhaadraa|| So Har(i) Beech Ahderan Ke Kar(i)be Kauh Kaoutak Keen Su Naatraa||478||
translation: He, as Ram, in extreme ire, performing his duty of a Kshatriya, had waged a war with Ravana; the same is absorbed in sporting with the gopis.478.

gurmukhi: jbY kiRsnw sMg gopIAn krI mwnuKI bwn ] sB gopI qb XO lKXo BXo bsX Bgvwn ]479]
transliteration: Jabai Krisnaa San Gopeean Karimaanoukhibaan|| Sabh Gopitab Yau Lakhyo Bhayo Basya Bhagvaan||479||
translation: When Krishna behaved with the gopis like men, then all the gopis believed in their mind that then they had subdued the Lord (Krishna).479.

gurmukhi: kwnH qbY sMg goipn ky qb hI Pun AMqir iDAwn hÍY g`Xw ] KY kh gXo DrnI Dis gXo ikDo m`iD rhXo smJXo nhI p`Xw ]
transliteration: Kaahn Tabai San Gopin Ke Tah Hiphoun Antar(i) Dhiaan Hvai Gadyaa|| Khai Kah Gyo Dharnidhas(i) Gyo Kidho Maddh(i) Rahyo Samjhyo Nahipayyaa||
translation: Then again Krishna, separating himself from the gopis, disappeared; he went to the sky or penetrated into the earth or remained only suspended, none has been able to comprehend this fact;

gurmukhi: goipn kI jb XO gq BI qb qw Cib ko kib sXwm kh`Xw ] ijau sMg mInn ky lr kY iqn qXwg sBo mno bwrD r`Xw ]480]
transliteration: Gopin Kijah You Gad Bhitah Taa Chhab(i) Ko Kabi Syaam Kahayyaa|| Jio San Meenan Ke Lar Kai Tin Tyaag Sabho Mano Baaradh Rayyaa||480||
translation: Whatever happened with the gopis, the poet Shyam tells about it saying that they seemed like fish writhing after quarrelling and separating themselves from the sea.480.

gurmukhi: goipn ko qn kI CutgI suiD folq hY bn mY jn baurI ] eyk auTY iek JUm igry biRj kI mhrI iek AwvqI daurI ]
transliteration: Gopin Ko Tan Kichhoutgisudh(i) Dolat Hai Ban Mai Jan Bauree|| Ek Outhai Ik Jhoom Gire Brij Kimahariik Aavatidauree||
translation: The gopis lost consciousness of their bodies and ran like mad men; someone is getting up and again falling down unconscious and somewhere some woman of Braja is coming running;

gurmukhi: Awqur hÍY Aiq FUMFq hY iqn kY isr kI igr gI su ipCaurI ] kwnH ko DXwn bsXo mn mY soaU jwn ghY Pun rUKn kaurI ]481]
transliteration: Ootur Hvai At(i) Dhoondhat Hai Tin Kai Sir Kigir Gisu Pichhauree|| Kaahn Ko Dhyaan Basyo Man Mai Sooo Jaan Gadai Phoun Rookhan Kauree||481||
translation: Being perturbed, they are searching Krishna, with disheveled hair; they are meditating on Krishna in their mind and they are calling for Krishna, kissing the trees.481.

gurmukhi: Pyr qjY iqn rUKn kO ieh BwNiq khY nMd lwl khw ry ] cMpk maulisrI bt qwl lvMg lqw kcnwr jhw ry ]
transliteration: Pher Tajai Tin Rookhan Kau Eh Bhaant(i) Kahai Nand Laal Kahaa Re|| Channdak Maulsiribat Taat Lavan Lataa Kachnaar Jahaa Re||
translation: Then leaving the trees, they are asking the bushes of Champak, Maulshri, Taal, Lavanglata, Kachnar etc. for the whereabouts of Krishna, saying;
